1/ The mrgn4 validator is currently offering ~8.65% APY on staked $SOL, making it one of the highest yields on Solana.

But what if you could loop your native stake and push that APY over 28%? 

Let's learn how ↓

4/ By looping your natively staked $SOL at a 90% LTV, you're able to achieve an effective yield of ~28.45% APY.

Yield breakdown (if fully looped starting from 100 $SOL):

→ 1,000 $SOL earning 8.65% = +86.5 SOL per year
→ 900 $SOL borrowed at 6.45% = –58.05 $SOL per year
→ Net

5/ This strategy unlocks capital efficiency for your natively staked $SOL, without giving up staking rewards or MEV yield.

Loop responsibly :)

1/ $USDC interest rates just got a major update on marginfi 

→ Protocol fixed fee dropped from 1% → ~0%
→ Interest rate fee cut from 12.5% → ~6%

As a result, borrowing $USDC on marginfi is cheaper, and lending $USDC earns you more.

2/ In just the past 24hrs, marginfi's $USDC market has become way more competitive:

→ Borrow rates dropped 77 bps (8.41% → 7.64%) 
→ Lend rates increased 113 bps (3.05% → 4.18%) 

Tap into better $USDC lending/borrowing today on
3/ Happy lending <3

1/ Your staked SOL on marginfi doesn't just sit there — it keeps earning staking + MEV rewards through the Replenish Cycle.

Here’s how it works and how you can use it ↓
4/ This cycle happens automatically once per epoch, but if you want to optimize early, you can also manually trigger the replenish from your Portfolio page (as shown in the first post).

5/ TL;DR: your voucher grows in value over time. no action needed, but power users can replenish early to stay ahead.

Do more with your natively staked SOL. On marginfi.

1/ Introducing the Activity Tab — a new way to view your account history 

No more digging through Solana explorers.

Use the Activity Tab to review all your Deposit, Borrow, Repay, Withdraw and Flashloan transactions — right in the marginfi Wallet.

3/ Each entry links to the transaction onchain.

Even better: you can replay  transactions directly.

→ Rebalance between $SOL and $USDC,
→ Roll over your borrow positions,
→ Routinely top-up your positions — all in one click.
Start using the new Activity Tab feature today on marginfi.
